title: Red alarm-style feedback on Valentine Question 'No' click

requirements.summary: Enable the 'No' button on the Valentine Question screen and trigger a repeatable red alarm-style visual feedback on click without navigating away.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Question screen, the "No" button is clickable (not disabled).
Clicking "No" does not transition to the gifts screen and does not refresh the page.
After clicking "No", a clearly visible alarm-like red feedback occurs (red styling + motion/flash) and then returns to the normal state automatically after a short duration (e.g., ~1–2 seconds).
The effect can be triggered repeatedly on subsequent clicks without breaking the layout.

file_operations.description: Implement local UI state for an 'alarm' moment when the No button is clicked: remove the disabled/aria-disabled behavior, add an onClick handler that triggers a short-lived alarm state (~1–2s) with a timeout cleanup, and apply alarm classes for shake/glow/red styling plus a brief red flash overlay while keeping the Yes flow unchanged (No must not call onYes).

requirements.summary: Add Tailwind/global CSS animations and utility classes needed for the alarm red shake/glow/flash effect in a brief, accessible way (light/dark friendly).
acceptanceCriteria: The alarm animation styles are defined in project styles (e.g., frontend/src/index.css and/or Tailwind configuration) and are applied via class names in the Question screen component.
The animation works in both light and dark mode and remains readable/accessible (no permanent high-contrast flashing; effect is brief).

file_operations.description: Extend Tailwind theme with keyframes/animations for an alarm-style shake and a subtle red pulse/glow to be applied via class names on the No button and/or its wrapper (keep durations brief and non-continuous).

Add any required global utility styles (via existing Tailwind layers) for the alarm flash overlay and any non-keyframe helpers (e.g., overlay color using destructive/red tokens with safe opacity), ensuring the effect is brief and looks acceptable in both light and dark mode.
